definition: breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: God is a caring Father who loves you and will never stop loving you.
sentences.chinese: 上帝是一个慈父，他爱你并且永不停息。

sentences.english: Concerned that the boy might get hurt, the referee called a time-out.
sentences.chinese: 思量到他大概受伤，裁判叫了停息。

sentences.english: Dew had fallen heavily since the wind had dropped.
For three days he worked without taking any rest.
sentences.chinese: 他不停息地一连干了三天。

sentences.english: Within the head, and comforts me with never-ceasing care.
sentences.chinese: 用永不停息的关怀来抚慰着我。

sentences.english: The storm could not last forever and the discomfort was not unendurable.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨不会永不停息，任何不适也并非难以容忍。

sentences.english: And their hearts but once heaved— and for ever stood still!
sentences.chinese: 他们的心也停息不再激扬。

sentences.english: The politician waited till the applause died down and proceeded with his speech.
sentences.chinese: 那个政客等鼓掌声停息，然后继续讲话。

sentences.english: The wind ceased, the torch was lighted once more.
sentences.chinese: 风停息了，火炬又燃了起来。

sentences.english: The fierce wind raved itself out.
sentences.chinese: 狂风刮过一阵以后停息下来。

sentences.english: From the evening rain today, cease after the faint moonlight climb trees.
sentences.chinese: 黄昏时下起一场雨，停息之后，有月光淡淡爬上树梢。

sentences.english: Ferrari is working with no respite.
sentences.chinese: 法拉利在不停息的工作。

sentences.english: That perches in the soul and sings the elegy without the words, and never stope.
sentences.chinese: 它栖息在灵魂之中，唱著无词的悲歌，永远不会停息。

sentences.english: Chickens and sell a few days, finally ceasing.
sentences.chinese: 活鸡又卖了几天，终于停息。

sentences.english: The names at the top change, but the rackets never do.
sentences.chinese: 上面的人尽管换来换去，但非法勾当从未停息。

sentences.english: Fears are overblown and shouldn’t stand in our way.

definition: to settle (a dispute)/to quieten down/to suppress
to spring up everywhere/from all around
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on

up here, down there (idiom); to rise and fall in succession/no sooner one subsides, the next arises/repeating continuously/occurring again and again (of applause, fires, waves, protests, conflicts, uprisings etc)
